Module chav1961.purelib
Package chav1961.purelib.basic.annotations

Annotation Type ConsoleCommand

@Documented
@Retention(RUNTIME)
@Target(METHOD)
public @interface ConsoleCommand

This annotation is used to mark a method to call from the Console manager. It describes command line template and help string for the given command processor

Annotation contains two parameters:

  • template - console command template to associate with the given method
  • help - help string for the given console command

template format can contains:

  • ${<name>} - variable part of the command. Command string content matches with the given name will then fill the appropriative argument when calling the command processing method (see )
  • [<something>] - optional parameter. Data inside the parameter can't be started with ${...}
  • {<option1>|<option2>|...|<default>} - case. Data inside cases (except the default case) can't be started with ${...}. The default case can be empty, so this construction will be optional.
  • <something><seq>... - repeated parameters. Symbol <seq> (for example (,) ) is used as a separator and need be exactly one non-blank char. Repeat continuation starts if the symbol <seq> is detected in the source string
  • <something>... - variant of repeated parameters. Differ to previous, repeat continuation starts if template after this construction doesn't match to the source string
  • \<char> - escaping. All chars are used in all the previous constructions (include backslash) need be escaped to represents self as-is
  • any char sequence - represents self as-is. Any sequence of blank symbols in the command line string are reduced to exactly one blank char

To get examples of using this annotation, see ConsoleCommandManager class Java code

Since:
0.0.1
Author:
Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
See Also:
ConsoleCommandManager
